website_summaries.verdict: A flavorful tea that provides long-lasting boosts of energy.
pros: Stone-ground powder is extra fine and dissolves quickly when sifted
Gives a boost of energy that will carry you through the day
Flavor is concentrated and a little spoonful goes a long way
cons: Strong, earthy taste requires sweetening, making this brand best suited for tea lattes

customer_reviews.title: If you know the real matcha taste, this is not for you
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to receive it,,,,,but,,,,,, I wouldn't recommend this one who knows Matcha taste. I knew this Matcha was not ceremonial grade, but I didn't think this poor quality,,,, to be honest. I'm Japanese and even lower quality Matcha in Japan tastes much much better than this. This matcha has No aroma and no tastes of Matcha. This is just bitter cheap green tea tastes and just the colour of green. I hope people don't think that this as a standard of Japanese quality even for a culinary grade. I totally agree with other reviews that even not for Matcha Latte (Mixing purpose) for me. I wanted to like this product but it didn't work out for me.
customer_reviews.author: ELEVEN

customer_reviews.title: After seeing all the good reviews about this item I decide to give it ...
customer_reviews.text: After seeing all the good reviews about this item I decide to give it a try. Not sure whether it is a very bad batch it tastes so bad I can not either drink it or use for cooking. Now the only thing I can do with it is to throw it away. Very disappointed and also puzzled why there are so many good reviews?
customer_reviews.author: Matt Chagnon

customer_reviews.title: This is low grade Matcha.
customer_reviews.text: This Matcha is a low grade culinary Matcha. The Amazon packaging photo is misleading. I was expecting a vivid green culinary Matcha - What I got was Matcha that's dull green and bitter. I would have never purchased this product if I had known it was such a poor quality culinary Matcha. It's always unfortunate when the product you receive is not the product that's advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon M & Dan K

customer_reviews.title: Either they are fake or they have never had a good matcha! This tastes like dirt and it looks ...
customer_reviews.text: No! Just no! I don’t understand all these 5 star reviews. Either they are fake or they have never had a good matcha! This tastes like dirt and it looks like dirt. The color is so off putting. It doesn’t mix well and it’s just blah. So many better matcha powders out there. I expected more from this matcha, especially For the price. I’m going back to Aiya.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: Taste really good
customer_reviews.text: I made matcha muffin with this powder. I didn't expect to get high quality product on Amazon. I'm from Japan and I approve this matcha. It smells good and taste good
customer_reviews.author: Kikibo

customer_reviews.title: Bland taste
customer_reviews.text: I’m obsessed with matcha powders. Ceremonial and culinary grade. I’ve tried a lot of them and I highly recommend you don’t buy this product. It’s a pale murky green, indicating poor quality. It doesn’t have the usual green tea taste. It’s more of a light berg diluted taste. I highly recommend the powder from eco heed instead. Two tsp of that is the equivalent of 5 tsp of this powder and it still doesn’t taste as flavorful.
customer_reviews.author: Xtinatea

customer_reviews.title: Green Tea Latte Recipe
customer_reviews.text: Make your own green tea latte, just like starbucks, but without the added sugar. A teaspoon of Matcha Truvia to taste Half a cup of hot water two tablespoons of organic half and half a teaspoon of Jordan's Skinny Vanilla Syrup A dash of nutmeg (MCT Oil for an extra boost) Heat and Blend
customer_reviews.author: Sara Jane

customer_reviews.title: I love matcha but I've been turned off of it for ...
customer_reviews.text: Tastes gross. I love matcha but I've been turned off of it for a while now because of this brand. My favorite is the Mighty Leaf brand I get from World Market. Waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you don't like to over sweeten your matcha
customer_reviews.text: I am not a fan of this product. In all fairness, I guess I am just used to the delicious higher end ceremonial grade matcha. If you don't like to over sweeten your matcha, I wouldn't recommend this product. It is kind of pungent in oder and taste (kind of fishy, actually). Sadly, Amazon would not allow me to return this product.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Does not seem fresh and has a brownish tint.. Gross!
customer_reviews.text: This matcha did not taste good at all. The powder is greenish brown (not a bright green like it should be), and did not smell fresh like it should. I compared this to the Zen Spirit matcha (also on Amazon), and Zen Spirit is soooo much better. Wouldn't recommend buying this one.
customer_reviews.author: @ChadGrills

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck with excellent taste and quality
customer_reviews.text: I usually do not post reviews but thought a matcha brand comparison would be helpful... So I am spreading the word. The encha brand is by far the best one however extremely pricey. Jade Leaf is a close second with excellent taste, color and price. SerendipiTea and MatchaDNA are much darker in color not as vibrant and extremely bitter aftertaste. Hope you enjoy this review and your macha iced or hot latte!
customer_reviews.author: bela

customer_reviews.title: Delicious!
customer_reviews.text: Really wonderful - I got hooked on green tea lattes at Starbucks, but the quality of this is clearly better. It tastes fresher / purer and the caffeine effect is great too lasting many hours but without the crash that coffee brings. I was originally confused by how small the pouch was as I'd observed Starbucks baristas putting big scoops of green stuff into their green tea lattes. The difference is this stuff is CONCENTRATED, so you really only do need half a teaspoon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Benefits are there! Energy, focus, relaxation all in one.  Replaced coffee for me
customer_reviews.text: This matcha powder was the first I ever bought and it exceeded my expectations. Delicious, easy to mix, and gives a noticeable increase in energy and focus while amazingly calming your mind and body at the same time. I even take adhd medication and this helps me focus even more AND reduces the negative side effects of the stimulant. Gonna keep using this as my new and improved coffee replacement! 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Obed

customer_reviews.title: OBSESSED:  better than Starbucks matcha latte!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Not very bitter Mixes well at high heat Suppresses my appetite (I have one each morning) Keeps my stomach flat (like wow) Wakes me up, not jittery like coffee (clean energy) Cons: none Iced matcha latte recipe Boil 1/4 cup water Add 1 tsp matcha 1 tbsp of raw cane sugar 1 tsp vanilla (optional) Use frother to mix all together (breaks up chunks well) Add 1/2 cup of almond milk, froth again Add ice and ENJOY :-)
customer_reviews.author: torii_hdz

customer_reviews.title: USE RECOMMENDED AMOUNT
customer_reviews.text: FOLLOW INSTRUCTIONS My first cup I used 1 teaspoon of Matcha (too much!!). It seemed very strong and grassy even though I added Almond Milk. I bought a Bamboo Matcha Chashaku Scoop which gives you the perfect amount for a cup. What a difference! I sifted the Matcha into a bowl, added near boiling water and whisked the hot Matcha with a Bamboo Chasen (Whisk), then added frothed Hot Almond Milk (equal parts). It was so delicious! So, if all fails, read the instructions :O I mistakenly ordered this Culinary Matcha by mistake, although it is quite tasty. I am waiting for the arrival of Ceremonial Premium Matcha. That will be a real treat!
customer_reviews.author: Rebel

customer_reviews.title: Yummy Non-Dairy Matcha Latte
customer_reviews.text: The flavor is good! I make a non-dairy iced matcha latte. The packet seems small and pricey, but I only use 1 teaspoon per serving, so it will last a while. Here’s how: 1 cup almond/coconut milk in a quart mason jar 1 teas matcha powder Microwave for 30 seconds Shake like crazy Add 1 tablespoon Torani vanilla syrup Shake like crazy Add about 2 cups ice Shake and enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Karen Werner

customer_reviews.title: improved hot yoga practice
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product in hopes of boosting my energy levels naturally. The benefit I was not expecting was the increase in endurance and stamina during my hot yoga workouts. This tea has taken my practice to a new level. Immediately ordered the larger size after several days of consistently using. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Teri

customer_reviews.title: ... never had a problem with Culinary Grade Matcha tasting like grass, until now
customer_reviews.text: I have never had a problem with Culinary Grade Matcha tasting like grass after drinking it, until now. The product is also very lumpy. It's possible that I received a poor batch.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Grear matcha!
customer_reviews.text: I am so pleased with the matca powder I bought, it suppresses my appetite, keeps me alert and made from natural ingredients !!! It is not particularly bitter and I even got a milk frother for mixing the matca smoothly. Very pleased from the product.
customer_reviews.author: artur

customer_reviews.title: I love fish but not in my tea :-)
customer_reviews.text: I really had high expectation of this product due to all the great reviews. However, I believe, I got duped! I'm not sure what all the rave is about and maybe I received a bad batch but my matcha tasted like crushed fish. Even though the color was vivid and I did use the ceremonial blending technique the consistency was still a bit off and very grainy. Not even making it in a latte form helped with the funky flavor though. It is almost like the product was not fresh or maybe the storage facility got it to hot and it spoiled. Either way I would NOT advise anyone to buy this since you are not able to return/exchange.
customer_reviews.author: Kasy

customer_reviews.title: Is good but doesn't blend well in cold drink
customer_reviews.text: Ok so I've just recently gotten into macha tea, all thanks to dunkin donuts matcha latte. This is really good! When mixing it with my almond milk, it doesn't completely blend. There are some chunks and some also stay at the bottom. So I'd recommended putting the powder in a small thing of warm or hot water, mixing it. And then adding to a Cold drink.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tastes like fish!!!
customer_reviews.text: Something is badly wrong with this matcha tea. I've had other matcha teas before and love the taste. This one tastes like fish!!! And returns aren't allowed for some reason on this product. I paid $40 for a bag of fish flavored tea. And I can't find anyway to contact the company. Buyer beware!!!
customer_reviews.author: Melinda

customer_reviews.title: BITTER, BITTER, BITTER!
customer_reviews.text: I am so frustrated that I just "accepted" that this extremely bitter taste was the norm and didn't return this right away. There's twenty bucks down the drain! I ordered another brand from Amazon that is also organic and it attracted me by having descriptive points that start with (first) Finest Culinary Grade, (second) 100% USDA Organic and (third) the point that sold me "Smooth Flavor Never Bitter." The first time I tried this new brand I uttered, "Night and day." Wished I had found my new brand earlier. This is one is the worst.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I recently received this purchase and haven drank it a few times, not long enough to say that I have noticed any Noticeable changes as of yet. However, I’m a regular green tea drinker and really enjoy it. What I can say is that this powder smells great and very fresh. It blends really well and tastes great in hot or cold beverages. I was a little disappointed with the size of the package. For the price I was hoping for more. Like they say good things come is small packages. Overall, I do really like the product and do plan on making future purchases. I’m just hoping to catch a better deal next time.
customer_reviews.author: Lissette

customer_reviews.title: Delicious iced matcha latte
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time buying matcha powder and making my own matcha lattes but I must say I was not disappointed! You have to find what works for you but after much trial and error I can finally make a delicious matcha latte. I use about 2 teaspoons of matcha and first mix it In a small bowl with a little hot water with a bamboo whisk from Walmart ( must have to dilute the matcha or else you will see clumps). Once the matcha is dissolved, I pour it over a glass of almond milk and ice. I add one packet of truvia, a little vanilla extract and viola! A delicious guilt free iced matcha latte!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible, Not Recommended by this Lover of Green Tea
customer_reviews.text: I drink no less than 2 teapots of green tea, daily. It's my fave. So, when I learned about matcha, naturally, I had to give it a try. I love matcha! But, not this brand. It's chalky and doesn't taste very good. I've tried other matchas (organic) and they were much better. It's probably best to buy organic matcha. Good matcha isn't cheap. This price of this brand says it all. You may have to spend more to get a better quality tea. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: True-Review

customer_reviews.title: no
customer_reviews.text: There's probably nothing wrong with the package of stuff i received, but no. This stuff does not taste good. It reminds me of that stuff my grandfather used to sprinkle on things called wheat bran. He ate it for the sole purpose that it was good for him, not because it tasted good. I feel Matcha has the same reputation. Super good for you, tastes horrible, but maybe you can hide it in other things without being too noticable. I would prefer to get my "good nutrients" in something that tastes good. To describe the taste imagine something that is extremely grassy, earthy, and carboardy all at the same time. That's it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very low quality matcha
customer_reviews.text: Terrible matcha, if I want to buy cheap matcha I will stick with Ito En Matcha Green Tea. I would truly like to shake the shoulders and cream What is wrong WITH YOU? in the faces of anyone extolling the goodness of this matcha. I drink ceremonial and culinary. This is your typical dark green colored DIRT subpar matcha. Please people try harder and don't think that starbucks level matcha is what real matcha should taste like. So glad I only bought a cheap sample pack.
customer_reviews.author: Ariele

customer_reviews.title: Simply put, Doesn’t taste good
customer_reviews.text: Really hoping I would like this brand but UNFORTUNATELY I did not. The taste is extreme (not in a good way) and blends poorly. It’s NOT the taste you want or expect from a good Matcha. It’s hold your nose and swallow quality. I tried it twice and sadly the same subpar taste result. Wish I could give a better review but I simply can’t do that or drinking another cup.
customer_reviews.author: Mmahabir

customer_reviews.title: RECOMMENDED...You can make it Starbucks “style” just as good but no sugars added like Starbucks.
customer_reviews.text: I love the matcha Green tea latte from Starbucks and I was skeptical about this one since I saw reviews that it wasn’t “even near” to the flavor of it. Turns out It’s pretty good and actually better. The Starbucks brand contains sugar and if you’re in any diet it won’t work out for you. To me it’s a healthier option but I still add sweetener (Stevia to not add calories) And I add any milk of preference I think the Vanilla soy it’s the best just because I do like sweet drinks but kinda balance it out. It’s a small package the one Ounce BUT have in mind you don’t need much for a glass but a table spoon.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Something fishy 🤢
customer_reviews.text: I'm no matcha aficionado but have had matcha lattes here and abroad, and have used it myself in smoothies, homemade lattes, and even a rather successful ice cream experiment last summer. I've used several brands, a few from here on Amazon, but I have never NEVER had any that tasted this ridiculously fishy. I bought this packet to duplicate my ice cream recipe but I'm glad I tried it in a latte first. So terrible, and a pure waste of money. I have no idea what I'll use this for instead. Maybe a salmon marinade? It'll fit right in...
customer_reviews.author: C. NewsomTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: High quality product
customer_reviews.text: One of my favorite Starbucks drink is the iced green tea latte but everyone knows how highly priced they are so I figured I would try to make it at home. I really love this matcha by this company! It taste really good. Some people complain about how small the packaging is but you're getting 15 teaspoons a bag. Sometimes 1/2 a tsp is good enough for one drink. I would buy again for sure. My green tea latte recipe: Warm water mixed with 1 tsp of matcha and 2 tsp of brown sugar Mix until both ingredients have dissolved Put mixture in a cup of vanilla almond milk and ice Mix again Enjoyyy
customer_reviews.author: Kat Astr

customer_reviews.title: Love this tea!
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised it was a small packet. But upon opening I saw that the powder is very fine and you only use 1/2 tsp to 8 oz of liquid. So it is a good value. Taste is impressive. I love the Starbuck and DD versions but I don't want all the fat and sugar. I use 8 ox of vanilla flavored almond milk (30 calories) 2 splenda and 1/2 teaspoon. I put it in my blender with some ice and blend it. Pour it over ice and it is so good!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Something Fishy Going On
customer_reviews.text: I've tried other matcha brands before and love the taste. Sometimes they taste a bit earthy, which I can live with, but this brand in particular, has a greater problem: a fishy smell, somewhat seeweed-ish. It's bearable if I hold my nose and drink it as the taste itself is fine, but the odor is distracting enough to not want to make another iced latte out of it. I did also try drinking it after mixing it with hot water first, but that didn't fix the problem. I suppose this is an acquired scent that some folks like. For me, no thanks.
customer_reviews.author: AC_9283879279

customer_reviews.title: Bad Quality
customer_reviews.text: Have been drinking matcha for years, figured I'd save a few bucks, but regretted it. This one tastes really bad, gives you stomach aches and makes you dizzy. Never experienced this before with matcha, so try others. Don't mean to sound like Im promoting another brand here, but there is a similar brand out there that is actually much better quality, starts with a k .
customer_reviews.author: Kieffer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Jade Leaf has the best matcha I've been able to find. I think it may very well be THE best.
customer_reviews.author: amazoncustomer

customer_reviews.title: A Bitter Purchase
customer_reviews.text: If you, like us, are used to drinking Matcha or Green Tea in Japan, do NOT buy this! This is quite bitter. Japanese Green Tea is not bitter like this. If you are used to American style, this might be up your alley.
customer_reviews.author: estacadaoregon

customer_reviews.title: Very good taste food grade matcha
customer_reviews.text: I have drunk matcha many times, maybe 30-40 times. I buy Uji Ceremonial Grade or Premium grade usualy, but because I put matcha in my cold matcha shake/water each day it started getting expensive. I ordered from my usual supplier Hibiki an in Uji, Japan but because of Covid and planes leaving Japan at a minimum, I looked for a local souce. This food-grade is very good matcha. It's a bit less smooth than Ceremonial or Premium but the matcha taste IS there. Nice green color, easy to blend AND it comes from Uji, Japan my favorite tea producing area. I bought the 3.5 ounce in case it wasn't good....I wll order the 8oz next time and keep ordering.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Jay

customer_reviews.title: If you want matcha on the cheap: this is the option for you.
customer_reviews.text: This is a rather low-grade matcha. Described as "culinary" matcha, I can see why you would want to add the matcha as an ingredient rather than the main body of the food/drink item. It's a lower grade that I've been using as my morning tea (it's all I can afford at the moment, so definitely not complaining about this option at all). I've substituted with honey and almond milk (I have a sweet tooth), and in fruit smoothies for a more tart flavor, which has worked well. If you're looking for sweeter, lighter, truer green-tea flavor, an imperial grade is better. -Of course it's more expensive, but if you want matcha on the cheap this is your option.
customer_reviews.author: V. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Super small size
customer_reviews.text: I should have looked at size description! It’s a tiny envelope with lower grade matcha. I guess I assumed for the price it would have been bigger. Not returnable even though prime. Hopes this helps save someone else from disappoint in size & quality
customer_reviews.author: Rach

customer_reviews.title: Do not drink this straight up.
customer_reviews.text: A little grainier than I would’ve liked. Extremely grassy and bitter. Best for smoothies and lattes with a strong matcha punch. If you wanna die a little inside, then drink straight up lol Edit: figured out how to make a replica of Starbucks Matcha Latte In a Grande cup add 6 ice cubes In a separate container (best of you have a mason jar with a lid) 1 tbsp of matcha powder and 4 oz of your preferred milk + your preferred sweetener if you like - I use maple syrup. Shake your heart out then pour over ice. Finish filling the rest of the cup with milk and voila! Saves you $6 per latte
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Strong tea extremely hard to mix still on the fence
customer_reviews.text: Office on the recommendation on a lot of other people who purchase the same product ,the one issue with this product is no matter how much you stirred it does not blend it's always sitting at the bottom of the cup so you have to constantly keep lending it extremely hard to get out of the package 1/4 of the product is stuck on the inside of the package and there's no way to get it off there must be a better way to package this, I've seen matcha tea cheaper I'll finish the bag I'm not sure if I'll be purchase I'll give it a little longer
customer_reviews.author: LuLu

customer_reviews.title: I was robbed!
customer_reviews.text: Either I am blind, or the amount of product in this was not apparent, because I just paid ten bucks for ONE OUNCE of Matcha, something I would NEVER have done if I had realized how little product was in the order. I feel entirely robbed, fooled and frankly: furious! I don't know if the tea is any good. I just know I feel like I was hoodwinked.
customer_reviews.author: Majesta

customer_reviews.title: great quality
customer_reviews.text: This is really nice matcha tea. I have been a fan of Starbucks iced green tea latte so thought I'd try to make my own at home. Just a teaspoon with a glass of Soy milk and ice, shake up, and it tastes great. It is strong, so you don't need to use much for a full drink. Very fresh and the packaging is nice- can close it up easily without using a separate container from what it comes in. Nice product overall for me.
customer_reviews.author: C. Renee Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Smoothly Blended Green Tea
customer_reviews.text: Life is all about health in my humble opinion. I think being a healthy poor person is better than being a rich sick person. Green Tea, especially Matcha Green Tea is a powerful healthy habit I have now. Studies have linked green tea to a variety of health benefits, like helping to prevent heart disease, type 2 diabetes and cancer, and even encouraging weight loss. I carry this packet around and add it to my hot water or smoothies or eggs. Yes, the story is finally true for me! Green Eggs and Ham
customer_reviews.author: Magnifica55

customer_reviews.title: The best Matcha I have purchased!
customer_reviews.text: It’s only been a three or four days since I got this delicious matcha powder, but it doesn't take long to feel how good this Matcha is. I really find it wonderful! I’m very sensitive to anything too strong or impurely processed so I am thrilled to state that Jade Leaf Matcha is neither of those. Yay! It has a delicate flavor and it is helping me with inflammatory issues, I can tell immediately. This is such a smooth Matcha in both flavor and in how it works with my body and mind. The company wrote me a very kind letter making sure I was happy. I can definitely recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Gabriella, Los Angeles

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: At first I was disappointed in how small the product was, even after seeing a review where it showed the product being small...it was way smaller in person :( Anyways, after using the product (only 1tsp) I made a very yummy drink :) I love this stuff Kinda sad because it says you can make about 15tsps worth and I really like it I’m probably going to go through it fast I know it says it’s culinary grade but I haven’t tried any other grade so not sure what to say about that? Tasted as good as the matcha iced lattes at Starbucks :)
customer_reviews.author: Dabjaiagavna

customer_reviews.title: Best green tea!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am an avid fan of green tea so I'm ashamed that I am just discovering matcha. This powder is smooth and tastes better than regular green tea bags. Its almost impossible get it to be bitter. I mostly love that I dont have to wait for it to steep, I can enjoy it instantly which is great for on the go mornings. My only criticism is that the powder settles at the bottom after a while so you have to stir the cup, or shake your thermos every now and then or you'll be drinking concentrated tea at the end. It's not a gritty powder so it's not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya Dubosse

customer_reviews.title: Don't know macha about life, but I do Love this!
customer_reviews.text: as someone who has just discovered macha (I swear I'm not living under a rock), I am absolutely in love with this company's product. The macha tastes fresh and 1/2 teaspoon goes a long way! I've been using the culinary macha to make iced lattes in the morning (using their tip of shaking it in a Mason jar) and I don't even need extra sweetener....just use almond milk. I really appreciate that they send you a pdf of the history of macha, their farm information, as well as so many yummy recipes to try! That extra effort demonstrates to me that they care about their product and those that buy it!
customer_reviews.author: alexandra

customer_reviews.title: Better than tea bags for me
customer_reviews.text: Most green tea bags on the market do not taste good enough for me. Although I sometimes buy Stash premium green tea, I found this matcha product and decided to try. It is good enough. I can drink this and I think matcha powder is a better deal for me than green tea bags. This matcha dissolves quickly both in hot and cold water, therefore fits my busy life. This tastes fine for daily use (not ceremonial). Although matcha strength depends on what I want each time, most of the time only a tiny bit is enough for a cup of tea. I like this product. Thanks for selling this.
customer_reviews.author: Dancing snowbird

customer_reviews.title: Honest True Matcha
customer_reviews.text: Did not wait for long for this gem to arrive at my door step ! So excited to try out the recipes and to learn about where my Matcha came from! Wonderful experience being at home during this difficult times. I followed directions and made a hot cup of Matcha that tasted delightful and made a cold milk latte. My daughter also tried it and fell in love. The powder and color and texture are beautiful. I am really happy about my purchase and plan to order again. A little Matcha goes a long way and I’ve had Matcha all my life really and this one is of great quality. Thank you !
customer_reviews.author: Melanie w.

customer_reviews.title: I've never had high quality matcha, but I still liked this stuff
customer_reviews.text: From what I know of the flavor of matcha (which is admittedly limited), this tasted like the one I had before, maybe a little more bitter. I find it's great for making lattes (iced and hot) and also good to toss a spoonful into a protein shake (both with sugar or Truvia). I haven't tried cooking with it yet. Overall I do like it and will likely order it again! I'm guessing that it's not a high quality product and I can only assume this is nowhere near the quality of ceremonial grade matcha, but I think as long as you mix this stuff with something else, it's fine.
customer_reviews.author: GhostFrappe

customer_reviews.title: Would consider before buying!
customer_reviews.text: It’s fresh but the taste aren’t strong. When blended, there are still lumps. Sill wondering any additional color was added. The green came out a little too dark.
customer_reviews.author: Spiderman

customer_reviews.title: Lovely and tasty matcha
customer_reviews.text: I love matcha, so I've tried a lot of brands. This brand stands out. The powder is a lovely, rich, olive green; the flavor is unmatchable (I just realized that word has "matcha" inside it); and it blends beautifully in my green tea latte recipe. It's a bit expensive for my budget, but well worth it. Give it a try!
customer_reviews.author: Marina E. Michaels

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because it received one of the top reviews in ConsumerLab.com for purity and strength of antioxidants among green teas and matchas. I find that it tastes nice and blends well. My practice is each morning to stir one level teaspoon into a 12 oz. cup of hot water. I often add it to a cup of hot herb tea – That way I can vary the flavor. I stir it with a fork. I find a whisk isn't necessary. A few times during the course of drinking, I re-stir it. It comes in a good quality resealable bag. I keep the bag in the refrigerator.
customer_reviews.author: Harvey S.

customer_reviews.title: ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS!
customer_reviews.text: My first Matcha Iced Latte was from Starbucks. My plan was to drink only 1/2 of it but couldn't stop drinking it. My second was a hot version. I decided to try making my own. After reading other reviews. I immediately emptied the matcha in a container for easy access. It took all of 30 seconds. To mix, just think of Nestle's Quik. Add a small amount of water with a teaspoon of Matcha. Then add water, heavy cream, sweetner or whatever your mix of choice. My tea was so good, I made a second glass. No bitter taste what so ever. I may have to kick my coffee to the curb. Will definitely order again.
customer_reviews.author: Thelma

customer_reviews.title: Bitter and brownish green color
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this brand because there are so many positive reviews, and I like that it is organic. I love matcha, and I wanted to make matcha flavored desserts and matcha latte. Upon receiving my order, I decided to make a Matcha Mille Crepe Cake and Matcha Latte. I was disappointed that the matcha powder is more bitter than other brands. The color isn't bright green. It is more brownish green. I like that it is organic, but for the price, there are other brands that aren't as bitter.
customer_reviews.author: Books By the BayTop Contributor: Lego

customer_reviews.title: Great value and taste
customer_reviews.text: Really like this matcha tea. It has a nice medium to dark green color and a medium-bodied taste is how I would describe it, not the stronger grassy flavor. I am fine with either flavor and probably prefer the stronger grassy flavor, however this one is such a great value and it blends so well. I use a frother and this one froths up so nicely. I know that may not be a huge consideration for lots of matcha drinkers, but I do love my froth! Very happy with this brand and I will buy more.
customer_reviews.author: Amy CC

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely delicious! I've been obsessed with the matcha iced/frozen latte from Dunkin and wanted it at home. After looking over several products on Amazon I went for this one. At $10 for 1oz it might seem like a lot but with this powder a little goes a long way. I put milk into a Solo-sized cup and 1⁄2teaspoon of powder with a dash of sugar and it's delicious!
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Saunders

customer_reviews.title: Best Match I have purchased on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Flavorful and fairly easy to mix. The bag is the best though, The seal has kept it fresh for months!! I somehow pushed a bag to the back of my pantry and forgot about it for months. When I found it I thought for sure it be bad, to my pleasant surprise it was just like the day I opened it! Kept alot longer than more expensive matcha's in metal containers.
customer_reviews.author: Rick T

customer_reviews.title: This matcha is so good!
customer_reviews.text: For the longest time I have wanted to try and make my own matcha tea lattes at home. I have finally found a really good matcha to do this! This matcha blends really well, I do use a frother or shake it with ice. I think it's pretty neat also that when you purchase this matcha green tea powder they send you an email with a starter guide that tells you all about the product. It gives you confidence in the product you are using. I make mine over ice with coconut milk and vanilla syrup, so good!!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany U.

customer_reviews.title: Satisfies my addiction to green tea lattes
customer_reviews.text: This is the only matcha that I consistently drink. I have tried others and Jade’s Organic mixes well, bright color and great flavor. Yes, it’s a bit costly but I was spending more at Starbucks buying green tea lattes so it’s my splurge. I hate to say addicted but let’s just say this is my “thing”. I drink 1-2 green tea lattes a day mixed with monk fruit sweetener and almond or coconut milk. This satisfies my craving without a ton of calories and sugar. I have also used in smoothies but not much else. I will experiment down the line. I will continue to purchase this brand.
customer_reviews.author: skylarsmom

customer_reviews.title: Before complain about the size....
customer_reviews.text: Yes the bag looks small, but you don’t need much for matcha latte, and it lasts longer than you imagine. After receiving the product, I make matcha latte every other day, one teaspoon each time, and I still have half bag full after 3 weeks! However, the powder doesn’t break and melt easily with cold liquid (like any other powder), so I use my blender bottle to mix the drink. It works really well for me. Side note: the company sent out recipes for how to use the matcha powder via email after the purchase! Check your email mailbox!
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte Tseng

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing gummy taste
customer_reviews.text: I was on the look for a high quality matcha powder to make a Dalgona Matcha latte. Unfortunately, this matcha powder was not good enough as it left an odd gummy feeling in my mouth. This does not happen when using high quality matcha, but I wanted to give this a shot and save money. I guess I'll have to suck it up and purchase ceremonial grade matcha in the future. This matcha might be better suited for baking. I'm going to try and use the rest of what I have to make a matcha mille crepe cake.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Best energy booster for smoothies
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is great!! Coffee don’t do it for me no more and every morning I’ll wake up so sluggish wanting to go back to bed, I have a lack of energy but as soon as I make me a smoothie using this matcha, it’s like I’m a completely new person 15min after drinking this stuff. I just love it. The flavor is delicious. I might have to order 5 packs for the month once my husband tries it because he loves ordering the Frozen Matcha Latte from DD and now when he finds out I can make him his frozen latte at home, no more going to DD.
customer_reviews.author: Karina

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to start making my own matcha lattes at home. So I went on a quest to look for good matcha that I can buy off Amazon, and here it is. I know I'm adding to the countless amazing reviews, but that's because this product is amazing! Pricey, but you get the quality you pay for. It does save me money making it at home then paying $5 a cup at the local coffee shop. It's a win win all around. If you're getting into making matcha items at home, this is a great recommendation. I will keep purchasing this matcha for all my matcha needs.
customer_reviews.author: Nina

customer_reviews.title: So Satisfied 😌
customer_reviews.text: Try this engridients I have use 2 teaspoon of macha green tea powder Pour little bit hot water Agave Ice and soya milk booms taste like just like starsbukcs! So Happy 😊
customer_reviews.author: Maria lourin mendoza

customer_reviews.title: Way overpriced
customer_reviews.text: I buy another brand of matcha powder Carrington Farms matcha powder at Walmart for $6.15 for the same 3.5 oz, the fact that this bag is $20 is insane, not to mention as soon as I opened it the seal at the top broke immediately when i opened it. For $20 you can't even give me a quality bag? And this tastes exactly the same as the cheaper brand, what a giant scam.
customer_reviews.author: adam

customer_reviews.title: Great for drinks and baking
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 1 oz sample size just to try and so far I am pleased! I've been making my own matcha lattes at home with ease and the taste is very similar to the Starbucks version, albeit with probably less sugar! My recipe is 1/2 cup water, 1/2 cup milk, 1 teaspoon matcha, and honey to taste. I am also an avid baker and have used this in many recipes including breads, custards, and cheesecake. Will definitely buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Not the best for drinking
customer_reviews.text: I originally rated this two stars because it is not the best matcha for lattes. However, it is great for baking and cooking with. The company was kind enough to send me a sample of their ceremonial grade matcha which is delicious and smooth. If you are looking to bake/cook with it then this one will do just fine. If you’d like to make tea or a latte I’d buy their ceremonial grade.
customer_reviews.author: Siri

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was my first time ordering matcha, I wanted to try something new, fresh and organic. This product is definitely what I was looking for. I mix 1/2 a teaspoon with 2 cups of boiling organic unsweetened almond milk and 1/4 a cup of organic maple syrup and drink this every morning. It’s pretty good and the matcha powder grows on you. It’s not disgusting at all, and it blends very well. I’ll definitely be ordering more monthly. The packet is very small BUT you get 30 servings per packet so it’s worth it. Highly recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: Trina

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff, Great company
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. Only had one mishap....the 1st time I made a cup (mug), I didn't think it necessary to carefully read the instructions/warnings. I made an afternoon cup using a heaping teaspoonful, not 1/2 teaspoon, on an empty stomach (all I had consumed up til that afternoon was four espressos). Needless to say, I suffered all of the warned of side effects....for hours. Mea culpa.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the hype or price
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed with this matcha. There was no noticeable caffeine, no detectable tannins or catechins, and it wasn't water soluble. I tried over half a dozen preparations and each time, couldn't finish the cup of tea. I think this might be suitable for baked goods or smoothies, but not for tea. I've tried many other brands at the same price range and they steep splendidly. I tried returning this item and the seller does not have a return policy. Also disappointed with the customer support. The only nice thing about this matcha was the color. It did have a nice rich green color. Doesn't match the quality of the matcha though.
customer_reviews.author: FallSol

customer_reviews.title: CANNOT RETURN
customer_reviews.text: Accidently ended up subscribed to this item, didn't realize. They shipped it without my knowledge, and now I find out I cannot return it!!! The item is good, when fresh, but it does not last long, and is horribly bitter, making it even harder to finish the bag before it goes bad. I don't think I will ever buy this again after this incident.
customer_reviews.author: Natty-boTop Contributor: Anime

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I've tried a few different brands of matcha ceremonial and I finally settled on this brand of culinary grade. I'm so glad that I did. I make smoothies with a cup of water, a cup of ice and a heaping teaspoon of this powder... I add a little stevia as sweetener and blend. This stuff gives an amazing clear boost of energy that does not feel uncomfortable like coffee does. For the price paid for the big container I'm set for a while. I have a small jelly sized mason jar that I refill. I'll be buying this brand as long as I can.
customer_reviews.author: marcus

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful taste
customer_reviews.text: I love green tea and buy the costco brand bags but felt I was missing something. I drink tea every day so I went to u -tube and Amazon and watched some different videos. the Jade Matcha was highly recommended and so I bought the bag and I am so pleased I did. the taste is great. I add water to my 24 oz. thermo cup, add 1/2 tsp. and a tiny amount of honey and just shake it. (I do have a tea ball with some green tea leaves in it-only cause I need to use them up). i love the Matcha tea Jade brand and will order more when the time comes. I drink it all day long.
customer_reviews.author: Doty Girl

customer_reviews.title: It's all about the iced matcha lattes
customer_reviews.text: I am just about to re-order another bag of this matcha powder so I figured I'd write a review while I'm here. I make iced matcha lattes almost every day and this bag lasted about 1.5 months. I use 1cup unsweetened almond milk, 1/2 tbs of matcha powder, and 1tbs of homemade simple syrup. I shake it all together in my blender bottle, pour it over ice, and the result is a well blended and frothy drink that gives me plenty of energy in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Yummy
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoyed this matcha. I enjoyed it so much, I bought a bigger pouch. To my surprise, (I should have better read the label in the picture), the larger packet had cane sugar in it. I was bummed about that because I loved this on its own so much better. After I finished the larger package of this brand, I ended up branching out & trying different brand. The small package of this was great! I just went through it too fast & needed something larger! I was not able to find a bigger package of this brand without the cane sugar but if I come across one, I would be sure to return!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa M.

customer_reviews.title: Not good for lattes
customer_reviews.text: I am kinda disappointed that it isnt as good as i thought it would be. Reviews are really good so I decided to give it a try. The flavor is too strong for me. I use this matcha for lattes and even though I only put a little it’s still strong. It also tastes grassy. It’s not my first time trying a culinary type but this tastes the same as other cheaper brands. I even bought a bigger size this time so sad it’ll go to waste. But I havent tried using it for baking. I think the taste would be better though.
customer_reviews.author: oikawa

customer_reviews.title: An every day treat!
customer_reviews.text: Light Japanese Green tea. I use this to make lattes. I use warm milk and some honey. It’s delicious, the green tea flavor is mild and welcoming. I use a fork or whisk the warm liquid with the green tea powder. There is clumping at the bottom for the cup. It’s likely my fault and my poor equipment, but I thought it important to mention. Overall, it’s a very good product and better than some matches that I have Previously tried. I will buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah H.

customer_reviews.title: Loved my matcha green tea latte!
customer_reviews.text: Packaging was excellent and it was a good first impression. The powder dissolved well in cold milk and I used a milk-frother. I used a teaspoon of powder for a cup of milk and the color and taste was great. The Trader Joe’s matcha tea powered sachets seems to have more intense flavor than this powder. But overall I loved my matcha tea latte with the Jade leaf matcha green tea powder. Update: Initially I got the starter pack, I loved it so much that I got the value pack as soon as I finished the starter pack. I backed some matcha green tea cookies and they turned out yummy!
customer_reviews.author: GM

customer_reviews.title: The BEST matcha powder I’ve ever purchased!
customer_reviews.text: Jade leaf matcha is hands down the best matcha product I’ve purchased! I’ve tried several brands over the years and have been disappointed each time. This brand has a nice, bright green flavor and color. I make both hot and cold matcha drinks and they both taste wonderful. Jade Leaf has become my number one, will never buy anything except, matcha powder!!
customer_reviews.author: clementine

customer_reviews.title: Matcha worthy!
customer_reviews.text: Matcha heaven. Day two of my hot coconut milk, a little bit of honey and 1/2 tablespoon of this delicious matcha. I heat up coconut milk in microwave then blend in blender with honey and matcha. You can smell how fresh the matcha is upon opening of bag. It is very delicate in a way to see how smooth it is...definitely a product worth buying. It isn’t the price it is the quality. I been to japan and I have enjoyed many matcha items so I can say this one is as close as you will get to being in japan.
customer_reviews.author: yessenia

customer_reviews.title: Matcha tea, a nice, different way to enjoy tea.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big fan of brewing all different types of loose leaf tea. As my first experience with the matcha tea ritual, I found the powder mixed very well and created a smooth drink. I like tea that has some earthyness so I really like this one. The health benefits are a bonus. It's easy to prepare so I will be having a cup daily. I haven't baked with it yet, I'll try that with the next batch I buy. I also want to try the celebration grade when I can afford it. Thanks for a nice introduction to another way to drink tea.
customer_reviews.author: L. Cuomo

customer_reviews.title: My body and mind love matcha!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love matcha tea and matcha latte's so I thought I would give this product a try. At first I was shocked at how small the bag was, maybe even a bit upset. But when I read the back of the bag and saw how little of the product you need to use, I got over it. I've been using it for a month and I still have plenty left in that pouch! I add a bit to my daily green smoothie and it gives me a boost of natural energy, my mind feels clear and focused and my body feels great. There are so many health benefits to matcha, I will for sure be ordering this again.
customer_reviews.author: Alyne Hart

customer_reviews.title: This matcha is my jam.
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't normally write such a long review but, it's worth it. When this arrived and I opened it, I was pretty disappointed in the size honestly. But that was my fault for not paying attention to detail prior to ordering. However, this powder packs a brutal punch and you do NOT need alot. A little goes a long way! For $10, this is worth it. I only use this for smoothies and shakes for myself. I use a 1/2 tsp to 1 tsp depending on what I feel like. It's great. Blends really well, tastes great and seals great in the packaging. I'll be ordering more in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: CatMom950

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I personally have no problem with this. Some people were saying theirs tasted bad, but I think this is great. I've only drank it cold with ice water, as it helps me wake up in the morning and rehydrate. It's got the real matcha flavor I love so much, and you don't need a whole lot of it to get that flavor either. It's rich and blends just by being shaken in a shaker bottle too. I was a little surprised by how small the package was but honestly a little goes a long way with matcha.
customer_reviews.author: Mika

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be a good deal to me your average Joe non matcha drinker
customer_reviews.text: First off let me say I don't like tea...and I don't like the taste of matcha at all...with that said this seems to be ok in flavor and mixes well for my hot and cold matcha lattes...I have started incorporating matcha and collagen and making almond and oatmilk lattes as part of being healthier (instead of a highly sugared coffee drink) and this matcha blends in well and if u like matcha I think you would like the flavor
customer_reviews.author: Roxanne

customer_reviews.title: quality matcha
customer_reviews.text: I like this matcha so much I'm subscribed to it. Too much coffee makes me feel sick, so mid-morning I like to make a matcha latte with this mix: I whisk in honey and add foamed half-and-half to my lattes. The only thing I don't really love, and the reason for four stars, is the packaging. I prefer matcha in a tin--it's easier to use. This one is a nice little ziploc, but it can be messy measuring it out. Sometimes what I do is and pour it into a matcha tin (which is also kind of messy unfortunately), esp when I want to travel with matcha.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha L. Holland

customer_reviews.title: Good tea.
customer_reviews.text: i got this to replace a sencha/matcha blend teabag I had been using. I mix this with a bulk sencha in a french press and get to drink tea all day without having to make an individual cup every hour. I really like the quality of this, but was disappointed in how small the bag was. I think they need a comparison photo so you know what you are purchasing. A little does go a long way and you only need maybe a teaspoon in about 16oz of water with a couple tablespoons of sencha.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbie Jean

customer_reviews.title: bitter-er than I expect
customer_reviews.text: My first experience with matcha tea is with another brand, so use that as a reference point, this is one is quite bitter. As far as I know, you're supposed to use "young" tea leaves to make matcha powder, which is more expensive; if you use older leaves, it still works, just...bitter-er. Otherwise, it's all right. It blends well. Perhaps if I add milk, it's gonna be smoother.
customer_reviews.author: XL

customer_reviews.title: good but inconsistent
customer_reviews.text: My brother had bought the smaller pack a while back and I loved how well it blended to make an iced matcha latte. It tasted very good too that I ended up using it more than him. I decided to buy it again but the bigger bag. I am not sure if it’s a batch issue or something but it didn’t seem to taste the same? It was still okay but it tasted much more bitter than the first bag I had tried with my brother. Only reason for four stars because of inconsistency. Otherwise it’s very finely powdered so easily blends. I will try again and see if the quality changes.
customer_reviews.author: ramannoodles

customer_reviews.title: A little goes a long way.
customer_reviews.text: To be honest, this tastes gross but I'm trying to do this for my well being. I need to get back on track and have a lot of energy like I used to before I had my daughter and be active again! Hopefully as I keep using this I'll get used to the taste. This has helped me a lot in drinking more water too, so I'm really happy for that! Before this, I wouldn't even take a sip of water a day so there's a big difference right there. I am feeling a little better and different in a good way so I'm going to keep going with this and see if it also helps lose some weight!
customer_reviews.author: vanessa cordero

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and great taste
customer_reviews.text: I had never had matcha tea before I purchased this product- it is great! Matcha lattes are fantastic. There is no caffeine crash and I truly believe it has helped speed up my metabolism. I tried this first and then purchased a different, cheaper brand from the grocery store. You can tell the difference. This matcha powder doesn’t have the bitter taste or “stick to your teeth” consistency of the cheap stuff. After trying another brand, I bought this matcha in the large bag and will never again buy anything but this brand. So good.
customer_reviews.author: A.M.

customer_reviews.title: Delicious and Healthy Smoothie
customer_reviews.text: Here's a recipe I tried out with this matcha powder, and it turned out to be super delicious (and for some reason it has a chocolatey taste to it, which is awesome): 1. One regular banana (or two small bananas) 2. Half a cup of almond milk 3. Add a little bit of water (didn't measure how much, but just not too much) 4. Two teaspoons of matcha powder 5. One table spoon of honey 6. One scoop of collagen powder (if you're not a vegan) 7. Blend it well with a blender 8. Optional: Add two teaspoons of chia seeds on top of the smoothie. Voila!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very bitter matcha
customer_reviews.text: I was shocked that given all the glowing reviews, the product was of such low quality. It's absolutely bitter - if you try the matcha powder by itself, you'll want to spit it out right away. The color is not the bright green depicted in the pictures but brownish-green. The matcha clumps together, but none of the matcha that I bought in Japan ever clumped. I doubt the glowing reviews are genuine. I also doubt that this is true organic matcha from Japan. If it is, it's probably the worst quality matcha that no Japanese would every buy, and the company is dumping it in the US for big bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super great matcha!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried several matcha blends from Jade Leaf, and this is by far its best one. The color is a beautiful, fresh green. It is very suitable for lattes or tea. When I make green tea lattes, the matcha powder dissolves effortlessly - I only use a spoon to mix and smooth out the bumps. I can taste the tea flavor and it tastes amazing. In my previous experience, I tried to save a few dollars and used the supplemental grade for lattes other than smoothies. With the supplemental grade, I could taste the bitterness in the lattes so it best suited for other applications. Totally recommend this product from Jade Leaf. It is affordable and tasty!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Lam

customer_reviews.title: Forgettable, unimpressive flavor
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to receive this a day earlier than expected. I was disappointed to find very poor blending quality, even after using a wand. I will probably use this product only as a hot tea or in a Vitamix smoothie. The taste was not nearly as strong as any matcha latte, smoothie or ice cream i have had before, which is a big disappointment because I will have to use a lot more per serving to get boost the flavor- thus leaving me with far fewer servings, and making this product feel overpriced.
customer_reviews.author: Jessa Exley

customer_reviews.title: It wasn’t what I expected, but it was WAY BETTER!
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was a matcha latte mix when I ordered it and was disappointed to see it was just the straight matcha. However, I decided to try it with the matcha latte mix I already had. What I discovered is that Jade Leaf Matcha adds that fresh and maybe even slightly bitter taste to the latte that makes it even better! I also feel that the energy boost and focus I get from the Jade Leaf Matcha is so much more than I was getting before. So highly recommend this matcha!
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Great flavor and matcha
customer_reviews.text: This matcha is great. Although it's culinary grade rather than ceremonial grade, it's still great. If you can afford or are willing to spend for ceremonial grade matcha, go for it. But this is perfectly fine for me. I used it just to drink rather than using it to bake or for culinary reasons. Just mix with hot water until dissolved and it's good to go. Although I started drinking coffee more, I still like the occasional matcha (since it has other benefits).
customer_reviews.author: Richard K

product_meta.title: Jade Leaf Matcha Green Tea Powder - Organic, Authentic Japanese Origin - Culinary Grade - Premium 2nd Harvest [1oz]
feature_bullets: 100% USDA Organic Matcha Green Tea Powder - Pure Shade-Grown Green Tea Leaves - All Natural, Nothing Added (naturally gluten free and vegan)
Authentic Japanese Origin - sourced directly from organic farms in Uji and Kagoshima, Japan, allowing us to provide much better quality at better pricing
Create Amazing Matcha Recipes - Culinary Grade Matcha is an affordable way to add a delicious, healthy boost to lattes, smoothies, baked goods, and other dishes
Healthy Superfood - matcha is rich in antioxidants, helps boost metabolism, great source of natural energy and mental clarity
Love It or Your Money Back - if you are not 100% satisfied with your purchase for any reason, just email us and we'll make it right
